column1: In the spirit of the University's mission to place the 'student at the centre'
column2: Student Services aims to provide high quality professional
column5: assistance and information on a broad range of issues for current and prospective students. The department aims to offer up-to-date and unbiased information in an accessible format. The services the department offers are available to all who need it regardless of racial origin

column1: Confidentiality
Each service within Student Services has its own confidentiality statement. In general
column2: no information about any individual student will be disclosed to any person who could identify that student
column3: without his or her express permission. Only in exceptional circumstances
column4: where the student is deemed to be a danger to themselves
column5: others or if there is a legal duty
column6: may this confidentiality be broken. With your full knowledge a confidential record of your enquiry will be kept
column7: as well as the advice and action taken. Upon request
column8: students shall have access to their case notes in the presence of a member of the relevant service.

column1: Monitoring and Evaluation
In order to provide pro-active and high quality services
column2: it is important that we (with your assistance) collate statistics on the types of enquiry we receive and the types of student making enquiries. From time to time
column3: Student Services also sends out questionnaires to students who have used its services to evaluate their effectiveness. The monitoring and evaluation figures are used in such a way that it is not possible for them to be associated with individual cases
column4: which would breach confidentiality. We monitor and evaluate to help us provide genuinely user-led services in line with Abertay's mission to place the 'student at the centre'.

column1: Complaints
If any student has a complaint about the service s/he has received s/he should do so in writing to the Head of Student Services
column2: in the first instance. Should this fail to resolve matters
column3: you have the right to use the University's student complaints procedure.

column1: International students can also complain to the Office of the Immigration Services Commissioner on matters relating to immigration advice. A copy of the complaint scheme is held by the Head of Student Services or can be found at http://www.oisc.org.uk/.
